DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study investigate new cardiac biomarkers algorithms diagnose acute coronary syndrome patient suspect acute myocardial infarction .
DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim study detect evaluate new cardiac biomarkers , evaluate improve acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) risk score , take account clinical , gender specific , psycho-social lifestyle-risk factor , protein pattern genetic variability addition classical risk factor respect primary endpoint acute myocardial infarction . Secondary study aim : - To provide estimate incidence ACS patient present recent onset chest pain ; - To provide accurate , quantifiable measure precursor ACS ; - DNA , RNA , cell , serum/plasma comprehensive genetic , gene expression proteomic study - To explore impact ACS candidate gene cardiovascular risk stratification use genome-wide analysis biological system approach ; - To explore protein relevant ACS ; - To allow identification new therapeutic target ; - To evaluate impact socio-economic factor ACS CAD risk . Patients follow hospital stay . Afterwards telephone follow-up take place 30 day , 6 , 24 48 month .
DOC.criteria: Symptoms suggestive acute myocardial infarction Ability provide write informed consent accordance Good epidemiological Practice local legislation Individuals least 18 year old Insufficient knowledge German language ( able understand write German language )
